Posts.Content: Has anyone here suffered pain / nerve damage from the Taxol Chemo treatments?  I have severe foot pain and my hands are still numb from treatments that ended six weeks ago. Thanks
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: On Nov 02, 2011 3:30 AM pipperpain wrote: i also suffer this side effect  it may never go away i was told by dr.  I have found wearing socks makes a big difference as i never wore them before areound the house. it either keeps the area padded or warmer, for some reason it helps me why not try it  and good luck Thanks for the tip.  Some days are better than others.  I guess it is the price you pay for being alive. Take care Betteanne
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: Vitamin E, who would have thought.  That is a really interesting article.  Right now I am taking Glutamine andVit B6&12 and seeing a naturopath next week.  I will definately try the vitamin E as well. Thank you
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: Thank you.....I have read about vitamin b and have purchased some....i guess its too early to tell....but hope it helps! Thanks again
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: On Nov 02, 2011 3:30 AM pipperpain wrote: i also suffer this side effect  it may never go away i was told by dr.  I have found wearing socks makes a big difference as i never wore them before areound the house. it either keeps the area padded or warmer, for some reason it helps me why not try it  and good luck Thanks for the tip.  Some days are better than others.  I guess it is the price you pay for being alive. Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply.  I am not sure what NSCLC is but I am certainly glad to hear that you are disease free!  I guess some pain in our feet is worth it in the end.  I just wish someone would have told me that this might happen with the Taxol, as I was offered reduced doses.  I have IBC and just finished surgery.  Starting radiation in a few weeks... but glad the chemo is over.   Thanks again for your info and best of luck to you. Betty
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your reply.  I think that going to a neuroligist is the only answer.  I think it is important to keep our oncologists up to date on this and tell them what treatments are working so that they can keep their patients informed.  Thank you again for your advice.
Posts.Title: Nerve damage from Chemo
